pull.title: [OSX, docs] updating some release build informations

events.message:
[OSX, docs] switching release builds to 10.7

gitian builder builds against 10.7. The docs should be consistant.
[OSX, docs] release binary looks like 64bit only

events.body: At the top of build-osx.md you can change "Tested on OS X 10.6 through 10.9 on 64-bit Intel processors only."

events.message:
[OSX] tested up to 10.10

remove 32bit text because nowadays it's obvious to support 64bit only on OSX.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,14 +20,6 @@ https://github.com/mingwandroid/toolchain4
 In order to build a working toolchain, the following source packages are needed
 from Apple: cctools, dyld, and ld64.
 
-Beware. This part is ugly. Very very very ugly. In the future, this should be
-broken out into a new repository and cleaned up. Additionally, the binaries
-only work when built as x86 and not x86_64. This is an especially nasty
-limitation because it must be linked with the toolchain's libLTO.so, meaning
-that the entire toolchain must be x86. Gitian x86_64 should not be used until
-this has been fixed, because it would mean that several native dependencies
-(openssl, libuuid, etc) would need to be built as x86 first.
-
comments.body:
As far as i can see, everything ist 64bit only:

```
Jonass-MacBook-Pro-3:MacOS jonasschnelli$ lipo -info ../Frameworks/libcrypto.1.0.0.dylib 
Non-fat file: ../Frameworks/libcrypto.1.0.0.dylib is architecture: x86_64
Jonass-MacBook-Pro-3:MacOS jonasschnelli$ lipo -info Bitcoin-Qt 
Non-fat file: Bitcoin-Qt is architecture: x86_64
```
